intro: Gnaphalium umbraculigerum, commonly known as the shadowy everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic properties. The plant produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its foliage is covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid conditions.
